Package ch.idsia.crema.search

Interface ObjectiveFunction<M,​S>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparator<S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Marginal, Marginal, Posterior, Posterior
    public interface ObjectiveFunction<M,​S>
extends Comparator<S>

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double eval​(S solution)
      This might and should be mapped to eval(solution, null); Evaluation of a solution should really be cached.

      Get the objective function value for doing the specified move on the specified solution
      boolean isBound​(double value)
      Test whether the provided score is a bound.
      boolean isImprovement​(double change)
      since we did not specify if a positive change is good or bad here we can get that information

      since we did not specify if a positive change is good or bad here we can get that information.

      • eval

        double eval​(S solution)
        This might and should be mapped to eval(solution, null); Evaluation of a solution should really be cached. This method might be called multiple times for a solution
        Parameters:
        solution -
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isImprovement

        boolean isImprovement​(double from,
                      double to)
        since we did not specify if a positive change is good or bad here we can get that information. If any of the inputs is NaN the other must be an improvement. If both are NaN it should not be an improvement.
        Parameters:
        from -
        to -
        Returns:

      • isBound

        boolean isBound​(double value)
        Test whether the provided score is a bound. This will be used to test if we reached a known upper/lower bound and should not continue.
        Parameters:
        value - a score
        Returns:
        true if the score is a bound in the optimizing direction
